mods.note: Colonel Thomas R. Chaney (1841-1914) was born in Connecticut and served in the Union Army during the Civil War. He worked for the US government afterward, and in the 1870s he became involved in the cottonseed oil business, establishing the first mills in Texas and founding the Howard Oil Company in Houston. In 1893, he bought Homestead Plantation in St. James Parish, Louisiana, and ventured into the sugar business. Chaney died in New Orleans on March 25, 1914. The papers consist primarily of business correspondence.
